helpgrid.innerhtml:
Select the type of ticket, work order, or sales order to which this response plan applies, and assign a ranking.
If the criteria that you specify on the Conditions, Assets, and Locations tabs are met, this response plan will be applied in order of rank. You cannot modify the response plan if the status is Active.

You can specify the date range for which this response plan is valid and a date by which a review is required for renewal. You can also select a shift and calendar. The plan is applied only to records that are reported for this calendar and shift.

When this response plan is applied, any items you specify here are applied to the ticket, work order, or sales order. The job plan or ticket template is applied before any other items. If the job plan or ticket template can not be applied then specify whether to stop applying the response plan or allow it to continue to be applied without the job plan or ticket template.

section.description: You can specify classification criteria for this response plan, select the internal priority operator (such as EQUAL, GREATER, or LESS), and enter a priority value. If you specify criteria, the ticket, work order, or sales order must meet these conditions to apply the response plan.
section.label: Response Plan Criteria

helpgrid.innerhtml: The response plan will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the service group or services to which this response plan applies. The ticket, work order, or sales order must reference one of the items specified in order to apply the response plan.
table.label: Included Services

table.description: You can click Add First Row to select existing structured conditions that compare fields and enable you to select records based on the result. The ticket, work order, or sales order must meet these conditions in order to apply the response plan.
table.label: Conditions

section.description: Click Maximize Additional Response Plan Criteria Section to write your own SQL conditions, or use the SQL Expression Builder to build expressions.
section.label: Additional Response Plan Criteria

helpgrid.innerhtml: The response plan will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the locations or location hierarchies for this response plan or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any locations or location types.
table.label: Location and Location Hierarchies

helpgrid.innerhtml: The response plan will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the assets or asset types for this response plan, or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any assets or asset types.
table.label: Asset Type and Assets

helpgrid.innerhtml: The response plan will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

include.description: You can select the configuration items for this Response Plan or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any configuration items.

helpgrid.innerhtml: Save the response plan before adding actions. Actions that you add are run when the response plan is applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order.

table.description: If you specify notification messages, the messages will be sent when the response plan is applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order. You can use a template or select a role or recipient to write your own message.
table.label: Notifications

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can change the status of the response plan.

Associate customers with a response plan if you want the response plan to apply only to tickets, work orders, or sales orders for these customers. If you do not associate a customer with a response plan, it can be applied to tickets, work orders, or sales orders for any customer.
